Pre-Game Insights: Maarten Paes, the goalkeeper for the Indonesian national team, is scheduled for a follow-up physical examination regarding his wrist injury before the World Cup 2026 Asian Qualifiers third-round match against Bahrain on October 10, 2024.
Sumardji, the manager of the Indonesian national team, mentioned that Paes has not yet arrived in Bahrain and will join the training session with Shin Tae-yong upon arrival.
Sumardji stated that Paes's condition has been improving day by day.
Sumardji indicated that the decision on whether Paes can play against Bahrain will depend on the results of the medical examination upon his arrival.
FC Dallas, Paes's club, reported his minor wrist injury before their MLS match against San Jose Earthquakes.
If Paes is unable to play, Shin Tae-yong can rely on other goalkeepers Ernando Ari and Nadeo Argawinata.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match between Indonesia and Bahrain will take place at Bahrain National Stadium on October 10, 2024, at 23:00 WIB, and will be broadcast live on RCTI and Vision+.
